website_summaries.verdict: An unconventional basketball rack design that holds one or two balls.
pros: Easily attaches to basketball hoop or post using included hardware
Can be left outside without the fear of rusting
cons: Not recommended for team practices or games

customer_reviews.title: Great functionality and compact size
customer_reviews.text: This is great product that well serves it's intended purpose. Some may prefer a cylindrical design versus square but I find the square shape to be nice compliment to the rectangular backboard. My 10 year old boys have no trouble storing and removing their basketballs and the metal collar with locking screw nut has held up to impact from basketballs. My only gripe is that if you're not familiar with using the locking collar, it may take you a bit to figure out how it works. To that end, I think a little guidance on the instruction pamphlet would be helpful. That's the only reason why I gave it 4 starts.
customer_reviews.author: Rough Neck Chicken

customer_reviews.title: Very Easy Solution
customer_reviews.text: We love this holder. The rectangle makes it very easy for my kids to retrieve and restack the basketballs (holds 2). My hubby installed this in minutes and we had 75 mph winds last night - both basketballs remained in the holder, on the hoop all night long.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Ivy Ambers

customer_reviews.title: It's overpriced for what it is (simple wire basket) but ...
customer_reviews.text: It's overpriced for what it is (simple wire basket) but it works as intended...that is to hold two basketballs. Note however that you will not be able to attach this to a square pole with the provided clamp. I used self-drilling metal screws and drove them into the pole to attach. Also, it's not flimsy, but it's also not heavy duty so if kids climb onto it or hang from it, it will bend. They should have made it from a heavier gage wire.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN

customer_reviews.title: Brackets don’t fit all goal poles!
customer_reviews.text: The hanging brackets that come with it do not fit all baseball goal poles. Just be aware of that! I’m going to have to rig it somehow. Other than that, it seems to be made well & heavy. Hopefully this will keep us from running over balls left out in the driveway!
customer_reviews.author: K.Rich

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution
customer_reviews.text: Finally the basketballs aren’t rolling all over my driveway! This was easy to install and it works great. I love having a place for things and finding a good place for our basketballs was hard until I found this storage rack.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Freedman

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Well made, very durable. We've had this now for a couple of years. Took an old basketball and cut strips to put between the clamp and the light pole, so it wouldn't scratch the paint on the pole. Has seen rough treatment by teenagers and hasn't bent or broken.
customer_reviews.author: Karl B.

customer_reviews.title: Great product. No problems
customer_reviews.text: Great for holding the basketballs in our driveway so we dont run them over! Fit our hoop. No problems. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Chalifoux Jr

customer_reviews.title: great item
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 12 yr old as a Christmas present. My husband had no problem installing it onto our basketball pole. It was done within minutes, now if I can only get my son to put the basketballs in it after he is done playing!
customer_reviews.author: J Crain

customer_reviews.title: Handy for clearing out the front hall
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, mounts easily, and keeps the balls out from underfoot. I bought 2, and while they are best for b-balls, the also hold footballs, rugby, and soccer balls reasonably well, and in combinations.
customer_reviews.author: R. Young

customer_reviews.title: A simple but perfect invention.

customer_reviews.title: The clamp that came with the Butler was too short ...
customer_reviews.text: The clamp that came with the Butler was too short to go around a commercially purchased pole. It cost me another $30 to purchase clamps that would work.

customer_reviews.title: easy install.
customer_reviews.text: made in the usa, well made. always know where the balls are, easy install.

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Well made and easy to install. I am happy with the quality of this product and now the basketballs are always where they are supposed to be.
customer_reviews.author: Smart Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Quality Storage
customer_reviews.text: I've owned one of these basketball storage units for a number of years now, and I must say, it has been well worth the money. Its well built, out of the way, and makes clean up a breeze (even the kids put the balls away). Its a much higher quality storage unit than the cheap plastic units that are available.
customer_reviews.author: J. Marier

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: Very nice strong unit made in USA, NO PLASTIC HERE, fits almost anywhere and is great mounted in the garage also. Easy to grab basketballs, @ any height you want.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

product_meta.title: Basketball Butler 2 Ball Storage Rack
product_meta.description: This durable, powder-coated steel basketball storage rack is perfect for keeping balls ready for play right at the court! Measures approx. 15" high and holds up to 2 balls. Easily attaches to any post up to 4-1/2" diameter round, 4-1/2" x 4-1/2" square or a 1-1/2" garage stud with included hardware. Can also be wall mounted (hardware not included). Patented design (US Patent #565,338).
feature_bullets: Keeps basketball off the ground and ready to use
Holds 1 or 2 basketballs securely, even under windy conditions
Installs easily on any 3in, 4in, or 4-1/2in pole (clamps included)
Also attaches to garage studs for inside storage
Can also be wall mounted (hardware not included)
